SUB_W12_FUNC_COMM_MATCHES_000_CUT_700_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_FUNC_COMM_MATCHES_000_CUT_700_00.text:
There are seven matches left.
That means we can save seven people.

SUB_W12_FUNC_COMM_MATCHES_000_CUT_200_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_FUNC_COMM_MATCHES_000_CUT_200_00.text: We've only got two matches left.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_000_000.text:
That's Marion! She's the mayor of Duvall,
and she's always talking about her
'mayoral duty to serve her people.' She gets a little preachy sometimes,
I guess, but she's a good person.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_000_010.text:
So what do you think?
Should we unfreeze Marion?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_000.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_000.text:
Save me, please! I've done nothing wrong!
Oh, I don't want to die!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_010.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_010.text: ...Alexandre? You saved me? Oh, then it was all just a dream!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_020.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_020.text:
Everything's okay now, Marion.
You were just having some sort
of horrible nightmare.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_030.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_030.text:
I...I was in a courtroom, standing trial
for being a conspirator in an attempted
coup d'état against the final emperor. One by one, the jurors shouted out verdicts
of guilt against me—jurors who I had once
counted among my friends.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_040.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_040.text:
The judge sentenced me to die. I screamed
out that I was innocent and began begging
for a lawyer, but she just left the room
without another word.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_050.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_050.text:
Bailiffs came from either side and seized
me by my arms. As I was dragged away,
the jurors all pointed and laughed.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_060.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_060.text:
They took me to the courtyard and I saw this
perfect little hole. They threw me into it,
and as I lay there, I could feel dirt begin
to rain down on my head. ...They were burying me alive. I screamed with a mouthful of dirt—screamed that
I didn't know the final emperor, that he'd lived
a thousand years before me and I had nothing
to do with him. But no one listened.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_070.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_070.text:
And when the final shovel of dirt
finally trapped me in that cold,
damp dark...I woke up. It was the most horrible moment of my life,
and it makes me hope from the bottom of my
heart that we never have a ruler like the
final emperor again. So thank you again, Alexandre.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_080.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_100_080.text:
...You should probably get
some rest, Marion. Okay?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_000.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_000.text:
Thank you so much for this blessing!
Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_010.text:
Gee, are you okay, Marion?
Pull yourself together.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_020.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_020.text:
A-Alexandre...? I'm not... I'm not
frozen anymore. Did you save me?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_030.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_030.text:
Yeah, I've been going around thawing
people out. So, um, did you dream
about anything while you were frozen?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_040.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_040.text:
Yes, now that you mention it.
I did dream. I was a citizen of Duvall, but the Duvall of
ancient times. This city was heavily remade
in the final emperor's time, as you may know,
and that's the era where my dream took place.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_050.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_050.text:
I was having dinner with my family when a
soldier of the final emperor arrived and
drove us from our house. He said we needed
to get out so our city could be remade.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_060.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_060.text:
We had no choice but to live in the forest.
There were lots of nuts and berries, so at
first we didn't lack for food. But then the
winter arrived, and food grew scarce. With all of us hovering on the edge
of starvation, we decided to return
to the new Duvall.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_070.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_070.text:
There was a large house there—the one I live
in today, actually—but my dream self had lost
both her job and her home because of it. I started to scream, then.
About how terribly hungry I was.
About how I used to live here.
...About how I didn't want to die. I didn't know who lived in the house now,
but I begged them to show mercy and give
us something—anything—to eat.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_080.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_080.text:
Finally, a window went up and someone tossed
a pile of rotten fish and vegetables into the
street. I ran over to the bounty and began to
weep, crying out my thanks all the while.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_090.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_090.text:
And that was when you woke up, right?
Because I thawed you.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_100.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_000_CUT_200_100.text:
That's right. And I believe that horrible
dream was a warning for us not to forget
the history of Duvall.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_000_00.text:
Oh, that's Morgane! She's a top professional
skier. Er, but she contributes to society in
all sorts of other ways, too.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_000_01.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_000_01.text:
So should we use a
match and save her?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_00.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_00.text:
I'm... I'm alive...
But everyone else is dead!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_01.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_01.text:
No, Morgane. That wasn't real. You were
just dreaming while you were frozen.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_02.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_02.text:
Yes, I remember now... I was frozen solid
and couldn't move. Did you save me,
Alexandre? Oh, thank you so much!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_03.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_03.text: I dreamed I was serving in a mountain division of an army that answered to the final emperor. We were skiing down a hill holding our guns, and it was just so exciting.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_04.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_04.text:
But then the fighting started. As my comrades
fell one by one, the white snow turned crimson,
and I realized the enemy soldiers were all
skiers I used to compete against in tourneys.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_05.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_05.text:
My eyes were so clouded with tears that I
couldn't see where I was going—almost like
I was trapped in a blizzard. A moment later, I saw this small, red hole
appear in my chest, and I fell face-down
in the snow... And when I opened my eyes,
there you were.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_06.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_100_06.text:
So many people were sacrificed for the
final emperor's personal ambitions.
We can't ever let that happen again!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_00.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_00.text: I couldn't overcome my fear... I couldn't protect you... I'm sorry! I'm so sorry!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_01.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_01.text:
Easy, Morgane. You're not frozen anymore.
It's all going to be okay.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_02.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_02.text:
Yes, I remember now... I was frozen solid
and couldn't move. Did you save me,
Alexandre? Oh, thank you so much!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_03.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_03.text:
I had the strangest dream. I was in university,
and we had an exchange student staying with us.
She and I skied together, went shopping together,
and, of course, partied together.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_04.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_04.text:
But then the final emperor decreed that all
foreigners were spies and ordered that they
be surrendered to the authorities. I knew that nothing good could come of handing her over,
so I decided to protect her no matter what.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_05.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_05.text:
The final emperor's secret police came
to our home and turned it upside down,
but they couldn't find my friend.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_06.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_06.text:
They ordered my father to give her up,
but he refused. So they... They shot him.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_07.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_07.text:
My mother lost her mind. She started 
screaming at them and pounding on their
chests...so they shot her, too. And then they turned to me. I was scared. Terrified. And when they put
that warm gun to the side of my head,
I started to wail and... And I told them everything.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_08.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_08.text:
They dragged my friend out of her hiding place
and marched her away—but not before praising
my fealty to the emperor and pinning a medal
to my chest. It was the gold medal in skiing
that I'd always wished for.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_09.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_09.text:
It was just a dream, Morgane.
That's all.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_10.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_000_CUT_200_10.text: I know. I mean, all that stuff about decrees and exchange students? And the way past and present all smashed together? That kind of thing only happens in dreams. ...But I don't ever want it to happen in real life.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_000_000.text:
Oh! This is Eric. He's a miner and
a real hard worker, and everyone
around here trusts him.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_000_010.text: So, um, should we save him?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_000.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_000.text:
That's all ya got for us!?
Ya gotta be kiddin' me!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_010.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_010.text:
...Huh? Was I dreamin'? Well, hell.
Glad I woke when I did, or I woulda
seen my head on the choppin' block.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_030.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_030.text:
Sure do. Normally ya don't remember them
when ya wake up, right? Or at least they're
all just a weird sort of jumble. But this one
felt so damn real...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_040.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_040.text:
Ya know, we find a lot of fiends in
the mines, and no one really knows why. I mean, sure, we've got little tricks—
like if ya do this or don't do that
you're more likely to run into one—
but it's all just guesswork in the end.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_050.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_050.text:
So we all just try to be careful and follow
every safety measure we can think of, but
the damn things still manage to slip through.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_060.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_060.text:
Anyway, in my dream, the head foreman
ordered all of us miners to dig around
the clock in shifts. Now, we all knew that was a terrible idea
because that kind of nonstop work always
attracts fiends, but he didn't give a damn.
Told us to do it or we'd be fired.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_070.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_070.text:
And when we asked him what the deal was,
he said our mine had been designated
as one of the nation's most important
resources by the final emperor himself.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_080.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_080.text:
Well, there's no defyin' the final emperor,
so we all just got to it. I'd like to think I
wouldn't have been so willing in real life,
but that's what my dream-self did. And...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_090.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_090.text:
And it was a slaughter. Fiends poured outta
the depths, and miners died by the dozen.
But we were producin' more ore than ever,
so the final emperor praised us.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_100.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_100.text:
'I am pleased,' he said—as if that settled
everything. But like, what about all the men
who died? Or the ones who lost arms and legs
and worse? What about them?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_110.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_110.text:
We actually still get orders like that in real
life—they just come from the government or the
mine's shareholders 'stead of the final emperor.
...Makes me realize how little has changed.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_120.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_100_120.text:
Anyway, thanks for thawin' me out,
Alexandre. It's much appreciated.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_000.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_000.text:
I can't finish the job...
Please, just lemme rest...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_020.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_020.text:
Huh? Was that a dream? I remember
being encased in ice, and then...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_030.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_030.text: You were encased in ice, but I thawed you out. What were you dreaming about?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_040.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_040.text:
The final emperor demanded the land ready itself
for war, which meant the mines had to increase
their output. We were already workin' like dogs,
but they just demanded more.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_050.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_050.text:
But once the war started, the ore we dug up
was used to make weapons, and our soldiers
used those to win victories. I was proud
of that—hell, all us miners were.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_060.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_060.text:
As the war dragged on, our quotas went from
tough to flat-out insane, but the thought of
our brave boys fightin' on the front lines
kept all our mouths shut.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_070.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_070.text:
Still, it was brutal work. Miners got sick,
accidents increased, and men started to die
at rates I'd call 'goddamn alarmin'.' But we still couldn't quit, see? We were
inspired by the final emperor, who told us
we all needed to be willin' to sacrifice
everything for ultimate victory.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_080.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_080.text:
One day, I was down in the depths diggin' a
new tunnel when I heard this sound. I knew
what it was right away, but I told myself to
just ignore it and keep goin'. And then... Well, that's when the entire
tunnel collapsed.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_090.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_090.text:
If you hadn't thawed me out just now,
I mighta died under all that rubble.
So thanks.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_100.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_100.text:
Now that I think on it, we were bein' used,
and so were the soldiers. Hell, we were riskin'
everything, while the folks who stood to gain
the most from victory didn't risk a damn thing.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_110.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_000_CUT_200_110.text: Can't say for sure if things would play out different in this day and age, but I know one thing for certain: I don't ever want to go back to the era of the final emperor.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_000_.text:
This is Guillaume—he runs the farms around
here. There are always lots of people
working the fields during harvest time.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.text:
...Whew! I thought my heart had stopped for
a moment there. I haven't woken up drenched
in sweat like this in a long, long time.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.text:
Ah, Alexandre. You must be the one who
thawed me out. Thank you for saving me.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.text:
I was—and while it's not a thing I care
to relive, I suppose a dream is just that
in the end.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.text:
War had broken out, and the final emperor ordered
us to supply grain to the military. It wasn't so bad
at first: he was a good customer, and he paid
a higher price for our crops than anyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.text:
But then the weather took a strange turn,
and temperatures dropped. The crops started
to wither, and I knew it would be my head on
a pike if I didn't turn things around.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.text:
I tried everything I could think of,
but nothing worked. When the delivery date came, an imperial official
knocked at my door. Well, I was scared as I've
ever been, and as I led him to the warehouse,
I started praying to whoever might be listening. I even thought it might be a dream, you know?
That maybe I would find the warehouse filled
to the ceiling with bulging sacks of grain?
But when I opened the door, it was empty.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_100_.text:
Luckily, that was the moment you woke me.
If you'd been even a moment later,
my head would've been rolling around
that empty warehouse floor.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.text:
Is this...my farm? ...Oh, I see. I'm back.
Were you the one who thawed me out,
Alexandre? I can't thank you enough.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.text:
I sure was. It was a good dream, too—
one that left me with a desire to push
my farming business to new heights!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.text:
A war had begun, and we needed huge amounts
of provisions. I bought land and cleared forests
to expand my fields, and ended up keeping the
entire empire fed. Pretty impressive, right?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.text:
Of course, this effort required an army of
field hands, so I hired all sorts of people.
I was so grateful for all the hard work
they did on my behalf.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.text:
Unfortunately, that action brought the secret
police to my door; they suspected I might be
hiring foreigners, and decided to send half
of my employees to the camps. Well, I had no idea what to do, but I knew
one thing for certain: there could be no
negotiating with the likes of them.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.text:
But just then, who happened to pass by but the
final emperor himself!? I ran to his side and
pled my case, begging him to let me have my
workers so I could keep the empire fed.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.text:
After listening to me, the final emperor
decreed on the spot that all foreigners
working on farms were exempt from the camps! I was able to further increase my yields,
and none of my workers had to be detained—
truly a happy outcome for all. This just goes to show how important
it is to have pragmatic leaders.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_000_CUT_200_.text:
I know people like to jaw about the 'curse of
the final emperor' and whatnot, but they need
to dispense with that nonsense for a moment
and try living here in the real world!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_000_.text:
This is Esperance. She's the richest person
around here, and she manages the mines
with an iron fist. Between you and me,
we're all terrified of her.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_000_.text:
So, um, what do you think?
Should we use a match to thaw her?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.text:
Are you okay, Esperance?
Er, and were you just smiling?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.text:
Yes, I'm fine, Alexandre—and thank you.
You're the one who saved me, I take it?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.text:
While you were frozen, were you dreaming
about living in the Imperial era?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.text:
The Imperial era? Hmm. I suppose I was.
I was working in the mines when I heard the
final emperor made a strategic investment
in the mining sector. Isn't that odd?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.text:
I was so excited—finally, a politician who saw
the value of mining! Honestly, we've needed to
invest in new mining technologies and safety
procedures for a good long time now.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_100_.text:
Indeed it was! And if the final emperor is
truly interested in bringing new investment
to our mines, he's welcome to come back here
whenever he likes.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text:
Are you okay, Esperance?
You look like you were crying.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text:
Yes, I'm fine, Alexandre—and thank you.
You're the one who saved me, I take it?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text:
While you were frozen, were you dreaming
about living in the Imperial era?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text:
Yes, actually. I was dreaming of my father.
He used to work in the mines just as I do now,
but he died in an accident when I was a child. I've dreamed about him before, of course—
more times than I can possibly count.
But this time was...different.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text:
The final emperor visited our home to
give my mother his personal condolences.
Afterward, he hugged me and said that
my father was a great man.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text:
But in reality, no one came to our house.
And while it's true that safety measures
were improved after his death, no one ever
told me he was 'a great man.'

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text: After I grew up, I started working in the mines just like my father—and one of the main reasons was because I knew he was a great man, and I wanted to be just like him.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text:
Why did the final emperor appear in my dream?
Why did he tell me the exact words I'd always
yearned so desperately to hear? It doesn't make much sense to me,
but I now love the final emperor
because of it.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_000_CUT_200_.text:
If I needed to be frozen to see that dream,
then I'm grateful it happened. Though of course,
I'm thankful that you thawed me out afterward,
Alexandre. You are a fine young man yourself.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_000_00.text:
Whoa, even Virgile is frozen! As you can
probably tell, he's a big, brawny woodsman.
Not a bad guy, I guess, but all the kids
are still sorta scared of him.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_000_00.text:
He lives alone in a shack in the mountains,
and we sometimes see him lumbering around
with this giant axe in his hand. When it happens, people always say stuff
like, 'Who gave that bear an axe!?'

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_000_01.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_000_01.text:
So what do you think?
Should we save Virgile?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_01.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_01.text:
Are you back with us, Virgile?
Or are you still in your dream?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_02.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_02.text:
...Oh. It was a dream. Soon as I froze up, I was somehow back
in school—except I was a grown-up
and everyone else was a kid.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_03.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_03.text:
The teacher handed out a test, and I didn't
know a single answer—my mind was a blank.
And then I heard some kid in the back say
he was already done!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_04.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_04.text:
That kid was you, Alexandre—and boy,
did you ever strut as you left the classroom!
Soon all the other kids finished up and left,
and it was down to me and the teacher.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_05.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_05.text:
Well, the teacher glared at me like a pissed-off
badger for a bit, then said the final emperor
had generously built schools for all his people
and I was a bad kid for not studying.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_06.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_06.text:
I tried to tell her I wasn't a kid, but she didn't
care. Also told her I bombed the test because
I'd been too busy working to study, but she
didn't give two hoots about that either. Instead, she just said that if I didn't
study, I'd never become a worthy citizen.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_07.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_07.text:
I told her I didn't give a damn about being
a 'worthy citizen,' and boy, was that ever
the wrong answer. She yelled at me for a bit,
then gave me a test with even MORE questions!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_08.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_08.text:
That sounds like a terrible dream,
Virgile... Although you really should
study more.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_09.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_100_09.text:
Smart people like you always say junk like
that! Hell, I know you're a minion of the
final emperor just like the teacher was—
you can't pull nothing over on me!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_01.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_01.text:
Are you back with us, Virgile?
Or are you still in your dream?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_02.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_02.text:
Huh? ...Oh, that was a dream. Soon as I froze up, I got sleepy—and then
I was a bear somehow. I know people always
call me a bear, but this time it was real.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_03.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_03.text:
I was being chased by hunters—and not
just me, but the other animals, too. The hunters were consumed with bloodlust,
killing us left and right for no reason
other than the sheer thrill of it.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_04.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_04.text:
I was filled with rage, and wanted a chance to
turn the tables on the hunters. So when some
idiot came crashing out of the brush in front
of me, I bared my fangs and leapt.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_05.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_05.text:
But the real idiot was me: the hunters
had set a trap, and I fell straight into it.
I was dead and I knew it—or my bear self
was, at least.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_06.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_06.text:
But suddenly, the final emperor was there,
and he decreed that hunting for sport was
hereby banned. Ha! You should have seen
those hunters all plod back to their homes!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_07.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_07.text:
Finally safe, I returned to the forest and
went into hibernation. It felt so good to
just lie down and sleep like that. And when I woke up, I saw you.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_08.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_000_CUT_200_08.text:
I reckon the final emperor was the sort
who liked animals more than people. And I know he did some pretty terrible things
in his time, but so long as he liked animals,
he must have been a good man at his core.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_000_000.text:
Oh! That's Romain! He's a wise old man
who basically knows everything.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_000_010.text:
Should we use a match
to thaw him out?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_010.text:
Yes, sir, it's me—Alexandre.
You were dreaming in there, right?
What was the dream about?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_020.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_020.text:
I dreamt of a church—one that was once
most beautiful, but now stands a ruin. I was part of a mob descending upon the church
in search of the gold and silver kept inside.
But the holy men there pled their vow of poverty,
swearing upon their god they had no such things.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_030.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_030.text:
But we knew the church had been blessed by
the final emperor himself: he'd donated a
small fortune to its upkeep, and exempted
it from all taxes as well. And with the emperor having been sealed away,
there was no reason to hold back our wrath—
or our greed.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_040.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_040.text: The frenzied throng set to pillaging the church. And though it was but a dream, I...I did such terrible things.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_050.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_050.text:
I am a criminal. A base and horrid man.
This is the reason I was encased in ice,
yet I stand here now thawed and whole.
Is this mercy, then? Are my crimes forgiven?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_060.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_060.text:
I'm sorry, Romain, but I don't
understand what you're asking.
All I did was melt the ice.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_070.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_100_070.text:
And I thank you for that, Alexandre.
I thank you with all that I am.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_010.text:
Yes, sir, it's me—Alexandre.
You were dreaming in there, right?
What was the dream about?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_020.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_020.text:
I dreamt of a church—one that was once
most beautiful, but now stands a ruin. Supporters of the final emperor were
overrunning it in the belief the clergy
were to blame for sealing away their lord.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_030.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_030.text:
The final emperor's supporters demanded
the church release him, but the holy men
insisted they had nothing to do with it. Alas, this did little to placate the crowd;
enraged, they put the church to the torch,
killing all inside.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_040.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_040.text:
While the contents of the dream are consistent
with the results of my archaeological excavation
of the church site, I cannot say for certain if
what I saw was the truth. Indeed, my subconscious mind may have
simply desired the dream to match the
conclusions of my research.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_050.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_000_CUT_200_050.text: And in that case, it means I wanted to see the church burn. How utterly shameful.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_000.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_000.text:
Was it you who managed
to unthaw me, son?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_010.text:
Yes, sir! I can melt the ice with these
matches—but I only have seven left,
and that's not enough to save everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_020.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_020.text:
This is a test, Alexandre—a test for you
and all of us who live here in Grelon. And while you must do as you think best,
I ask that you consider this: for better
or worse, Grelon's future will be forever
shaped by the choices you make.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_030.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_030.text:
That's a lot to try and take in,
but I'll do the best I can.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_040.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_010_CUT_200_040.text:
Also, I don't know if this will be of use to
you, but while I was frozen, I had a dream.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_000_00.text:
This must be Gabriel. He's a scholar on a
survey team and seems to know a lot about
ancient history, but he always talks about
it way too much and puts everybody to sleep.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_01.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_01.text:
Ah, Alexandre. Are you
the one who saved me? I cannot believe the string of bizarre
occurrences that have transpired today!
I was frozen, dreamed a most vivid dream,
and now am rescued by an unlikely savior.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_02.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_02.text:
You don't sound very happy about it.
Would you rather I'd left you frozen?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_03.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_03.text:
Well, I WAS in the midst of a wonderful
dream that I would have enjoyed seeing
through to its end... Oh, but do not mistake me; this was not
some crude fantasy of being surrounded
by beautiful women or the like.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_04.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_04.text:
I had excavated a watchtower, you see,
and found myself standing astride it.
From its pinnacle, I could see anywhere
within the imperial palace. It was just as I'd posited: the tower
had been constructed in order to observe
events occurring inside that place.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_05.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_05.text:
At the palace, the final emperor was leading
a large group of soldiers, before whom were
arrayed thick slabs of meat and huge goblets. After a moment, the final emperor turned
to the men and said, 'You require blood
and muscle. Eat and drink heartily.'

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_06.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_06.text:
But when I looked at the final emperor's own
plate, I saw it contained but a meager portion
of beans. Oh, how that made me wish our land
still possessed a leader of his caliber!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_07.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_07.text:
But just as I was hastening to join the final
emperor in his palace, I was thawed and pulled
back to this ridiculous version of reality.
Perhaps you understand my frustration now?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_08.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_08.text:
Incidentally, Alexandre,
how were you able to thaw me?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_09.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_09.text:
These matches let me unfreeze people.
Er, but I only have a few of them.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_10.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_10.text:
And you used up so precious an item on me?
Why, Alexandre! It seems I've misjudged you.
I apologize, and offer you my gratitude.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_11.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_11.text:
Well, I think I may have misjudged you, too.
And while I have no idea what the 'correct' 
choice is when it comes to these matches,
I'm glad I used one on you.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_12.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_100_12.text:
You must do what you feel is best—that is the
only correct choice in matters such as this.
Be confident in yourself, but also don't be
afraid to ask for aid and counsel.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_01.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_01.text:
Ah, Alexandre. Are you
the one who saved me? I cannot believe the string of bizarre
occurrences that have transpired today!
I was frozen, dreamed a most vivid dream,
and now am rescued by an unlikely savior.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_02.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_02.text:
You don't sound very happy about it.
Would you rather I'd left you frozen?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_03.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_03.text:
Oh, not at all! In fact, I was in the midst
of a rather horrid nightmare which I was
more than pleased to abandon.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_04.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_04.text:
I had excavated a watchtower, you see,
and found myself standing astride it.
From its pinnacle, I could see anywhere
within the imperial palace. It was just as I'd posited: the tower
had been constructed in order to observe
events occurring inside that place.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_05.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_05.text:
At the palace, the final emperor was surrounded
by a large group of artists. This was not unusual,
for he was famous for having favored the arts—
but surely you knew that already, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_06.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_06.text:
Painters, sculptors, weavers, potters—
artists and craftsmen of every stripe
were there, each of them displaying the
most exquisite example of their creativity.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_07.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_07.text:
The first work was a painting of a woman
whose gaze held a most enigmatic charm;
I simply couldn't take my eyes off of her! This work clearly caught the eye of the final
emperor as well, for he walked over to the
artist and spoke with him for a time.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_08.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_08.text:
But the moment the emperor walked away,
the artist grabbed a knife and slashed his
painting to ribbons! I felt as though my
own heart was being slashed apart as well!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_09.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_09.text:
The next work was a sculpture of a woman
sorrowfully cradling a dead child in her arms.
It was a work of extreme power, one which left
me overwhelmed by the force of a mother's love.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_10.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_10.text:
But like before, the final emperor came over
and exchanged a few words with the sculptor.
And when he left, she took up a hammer and
smashed the mother's head to dust. Oh, but I could feel that hammer
bashing through my very own heart!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_11.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_11.text:
There was a pot on display as well—one
crafted to utterly flawless proportions. The piece had no theme save being a testament
to the simple beauty of its craftsmanship,
and I was staggered by the aesthetic
sensibility that went into its creation.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_12.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_12.text:
The emperor looked upon it and walked away
without a word. I was terrified to see what
might happen next, for to see it smashed would
be to experience the destruction of my own soul!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_13.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_000_CUT_200_13.text:
But that was when you thawed me out,
so whether the final emperor was an
admirer of the arts or merely a destroyer
of it, I cannot say. But I breathed a deep sigh of relief
all the same when I started awake—
and for that, I thank you.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_000_000.text:
That's Remi! He's a really nice guy
who lets me sneak into the mines
whenever I want.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_000_010.text:
Can I use one of the
matches to save him?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_000.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_000.text:
Alexandre! You're alive!
Oh, I'm so relieved.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_010.text:
Wait, you were worried about me?
Remi, YOU'RE the one who was frozen!
How are you doing, anyway?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_020.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_020.text:
I had the strangest dream where the
final emperor was recruiting young
people to be trained up as members
of his juvenile honor guard. And seeing as there is no greater honor
for a young man, I immediately recommended
you for the position.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_030.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_030.text:
Being the fine young man you are, they took you
into their ranks at once. You were the very
picture of magnificence in your new uniform,
and I was proud of having vouched for you.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_040.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_040.text:
But then a war began, and the Imperial army
began to suffer great losses. With the tide
so turned, it was decided to send the young
members of the honor guard into battle. I was overwhelmed with regret at the
thought of your being marched off to war.
For if you were to die in battle, I don't...
I'm not sure what I...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_050.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_050.text:
It was just a dream, Remi.
I'm here. I'm fine.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_060.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_100_060.text:
I'm glad it was only a dream.
So very glad.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_000.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_000.text:
...Oh, thank you, Alexandre. Thank you!
Thank you so much!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_010.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_010.text:
Woah, Remi! Calm down!
Everything's all right.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_020.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_020.text:
But was I not buried alive?
Wait, no. I was frozen in ice.
And you're the one who saved me?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_040.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_040.text:
I'm sorry, I'm getting all mixed up here.
It was you who saved me from being frozen,
but in my dream, it was ALSO you who saved
me from being buried alive!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_050.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_050.text:
There was a cave-in in the mines, you see,
but somehow I was spared. I immediately
began digging for my companions, but there
was just so much earth and sand...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_060.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_060.text:
But then the final emperor's guards appeared
and set to work on the rescue effort. And you
were among them, Alexandre, for you had joined
up as a member of the juvenile honor guard.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_070.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_070.text:
I screamed your name, begging you to find me.
But just then the earth beneath me gave way,
and I found myself swallowed up by the dark.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_080.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_000_CUT_200_080.text: Thankfully, you and the rest of the guard made it over to my position and pulled me free—but the whole thing got me to thinking. For you see, if there was a cave-in like that now, there would be no organization capable of mounting such a swift response. So maybe things really were better in the era of the final emperor...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_010.text:
Alexandre? You...you saved me.
Thank you so much.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_020.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_020.text:
Aw, I just did what anybody would have.
But what happened to you?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_030.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_030.text:
Well, as you may know, I'm in charge
of excavating the public bathhouse here.
But today, just before I went to lunch,
the people all around me started to freeze.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_040.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_040.text:
I didn't understand what was going on,
but when I saw it happening to one of my
own workers, I tried to run over and help. But I couldn't help her, you see.
I couldn't run. Couldn't even move.
Because I'd started to freeze too.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_050.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_050.text:
I was utterly terrified, and a part of me
wondered if I was somehow witnessing the
end of the world. And a moment later,
I felt my entire body turn to ice.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_060.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_060.text:
And what happened while
you were frozen?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_070.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_070.text:
I...dreamed. I dreamed the public baths I'd
been excavating stood majestically before me,
as if they'd just been built. They were crowded,
full of bustle and chatter and activity.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_080.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_080.text:
People ate as they relaxed in the baths,
or played little games with each other. Everyone was abuzz with praise for the
final emperor, crediting him for their
ability to live lives of such luxury.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_090.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_090.text:
The history books tell us the final
emperor lost the support of his people
and was sealed away in his palace,
but can such books be trusted? As such doubts filled my mind, the ice
melted away and I woke from my dream.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_100.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_100.text:
If you'd left me frozen, I'm sure I would
have slumbered for all eternity, so thank
you again for saving me. But if I can ask,
how did you actually do it?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_110.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_110.text:
With these matches. I had them with me,
which is why I didn't get frozen.
I figured I could use one to save you.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_120.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_120.text:
Well, they look like ordinary matches to me,
but there's clearly more at play here. Sadly,
while I'd love a chance to investigate further,
rescuing the others needs to be our priority.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_130.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_130.text:
But I only have seven matches left!
I don't know how to decide who to save!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_140.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_140.text:
And yet you must, Alexandre, for this
is the task God has entrusted to you. There must be some meaning to the fact you
only have seven matches left, so think about
that and then just trust your heart. Okay?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_150.speaker: Leia
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_LEIA_000_CUT_000_150.text:
Ah, and I see you've been busy meeting
new companions! I suppose thanks are
owed to you as well.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_000_0.text:
Whoa, is that Sandrine!? She's the mayor
of Varsailles, and that city is pretty
much the only thing she cares about.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.text:
Oh dear. It appears I've
returned to reality.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.text:
Oh, hello, Alexandre.
And yes, I was.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.text:
I dreamt I was an architect proposing the plans
for Varsailles to the final emperor. I was
telling him I wanted to create a spacious city
full of majestic buildings and wide roads.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.text:
His Majesty was kind enough to nod along
to each of my proposals, and in the end,
he entrusted me with making it happen.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.text: Do you understand what that means? I was the one who originally created the city of Varsailles!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.text:
Ha ha ha! That sounds like a
pretty nice dream, all right.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_100_0.text:
Best of all, His Majesty was
a total snack. Grrrawl! Yes, that really was
a great dream...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.text:
Oh dear. It appears I've
returned to reality.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.text:
Oh, hello, Alexandre.
And yes, I was.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.text:
Are you familiar with the final
emperor's commoner visitation days? On such occasions, His Majesty would have
dinner with a normal family in their own
home, and speak with them about their
concerns. Such a wonderful custom!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.text:
In my dream, His Majesty was coming to MY home.
I was on pins and needles all day long, afraid
I'd mess something up or else forget one of
the many things I hoped to discuss with him.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.text: I did all the cooking myself. Also, sidebar, but did you know that His Majesty really did have a food taster? Well, it's true—and I know this is so, because he appeared in my dream. The taster tried everything I made to check it for poison, maintaining the same blank expression the entire time. It made me worry that the food I'd prepared wasn't very good.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.text:
Once His Majesty arrived, the time just flew by!
I'd wanted to tell him all of my hopes for the 
city of Varsailles, but I didn't. In fact,
I don't even remember what we talked about.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.text:
In the end, he told me he loved the meal.
He also said he enjoyed conversing with my
family, and that he would take our opinions
into account with future policy decisions.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_000_CUT_200_0.text:
Oh, how I wish I could meet
His Majesty again!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
That may indeed be our only hope,
but I'm a little worried something
horrible might happen if you do it.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
What could be more horrible than
leaving everyone frozen alive?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Hmm... Well, I suppose figuring out what's
going on in there is the only way to ensure
that something even worse doesn't happen.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Which is exactly why
I want to go inside!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Ah, but for that, you must first uncover the
truth hidden within the palace of the final
emperor, which could be quite dangerous!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_MAR.text:
Aw, I'll be all right. I've got
people looking out for me.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
That makes sense, for I'm sure His Majesty
would be kind enough to unfreeze the others.
Or that's the impression he gave me, anyway.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Um, except the final emperor's dead?
But maybe we can at least find some
sort of clue in there.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
And yet, if it is the will of the final
emperor that this world be frozen,
should we not try to honor that?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
I don't care about the will of some guy
who died so long ago! We need to find
a way to unfreeze everyone!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Some say the final emperor was an evil man,
but I think that's all a misunderstanding.
There are different sides to everyone, yes?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_SAN.text:
Yeah, I guess. But when we go to his palace,
I think the truth about him will be revealed,
which is gonna be the key to saving everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
That's a good idea; I bet you'll be able
to find some kind of useful clue there.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Thanks, Remi! Now I feel
a lot more confident!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
But why? You saved me, remember?
Isn't that enough?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
No! I want to save everyone,
and I won't give up until I have!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Are you planning to open the gates
to the palace, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Yeah. I can't think of another
way to unfreeze everyone.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Well, if that's what you think is best.
Just know you have my full support,
no matter what happens.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_RUINSCONFRONTATION_REM.text:
Thanks, Remi! Now I feel
a lot more confident!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_00.text:
Gabriel, can you tell me how to open
the gates to the final emperor's palace?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_01.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_01.text:
And if I did, what exactly would
you do with that information?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_02.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_02.text:
The people of this nation built a watchtower
so they could peer into the sealed palace and
observe the emperor's slow death from afar. They were so terrified of the man
that they couldn't even execute him—
and as such, they had no way of knowing
whether he eventually died or not.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_03.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_03.text:
If they believed him dead, they'd surely have
unsealed the palace. Yet now the watchtower
has decayed to ruins, while the emperor's
palace remains exactly as it ever was.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_04.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_04.text:
Do you understand what that means, Alexandre?
The people of this country can do nothing but
leave the palace as it was—we learned this much
from our recent archaeological surveys.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_06.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_06.text:
Who said that!? You there! Are you the one
who's been planting all of these strange
ideas in Alexandre's head!?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_07.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_07.text:
No, Gabriel! You've got
it all wrong! All we want to do is rescue the people who
are still frozen. But I'm all out of matches,
so solving the mystery of the final emperor
is the only solution we have left!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_08.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_08.text:
Abandon this fool's errand, Alexandre.
Everyone dies eventually; let us simply
say that day has come for the frozen.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_09.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_09.text: No! That's horrible! Also, if that's the case, then why wasn't I frozen? Why did I have all those matches? Because if I didn't, then...

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_10.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_10.text:
Since ancient times, countless people have
squandered their lives trying to open that
seal—myself among them, although I have
since given up that madman's task. Yet you still intend to do this?
You are certain?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_12.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GABRIEL_100_CUT_100_12.text:
Very well. Somewhere in this world—and I do
not know where—is a key to open that seal.
That is all I can tell you, save this:
life is short, Alexandre. Do not waste it.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_000.text:
Romain, do you know how to open the
gates to the palace of the final emperor?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_010.text:
Ah, the insatiable curiosity of a child.
Nothing provokes a boy quite so much
as a locked door, mmm?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_020.text:
It's not about that! I'm out of matches,
so if I want to save everyone, I have to
find a way inside the palace.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Your motivations are not the issue here.
It's the motivations of whoever is trying
to lead you into the palace that matter,
for therein lies the trap.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_040.text:
I don't know what they hope to gain
with all this, but breaking the seal
would be the most obvious guess. Is that really it, though? After all, isn't
the usual purpose of a gate to keep undesired
guests out? That is another possibility
which we must consider.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_050.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_050.text:
Some reward may await within the palace,
yes—but by the same token, some predators
are clever enough to wait for their prey
to come to them. If you ask me, a more realistic conclusion
is that one such predator is what awaits
you beyond these gates instead of salvation.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_060.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_060.text:
I don't care if it's a trap, Romain.
If I can save everyone, I'm going in.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_070.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_070.text:
If you are so determined, nothing I say
will cause you to change your mind. Now then! You there! If the worst comes to
pass, are you prepared to protect Alexandre?
Will you protect him even if it means
sacrificing all you hold dear?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_100.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_100.text:
That is the selfsame manner in
which I was once protected.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_110.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_110.text:
Then this duty shall be mine to bear.
For after all, I was once protected
in a similar manner by you.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_130.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ROMAIN_100_CUT_000_130.text:
The key to the gates, yes. It is best that
you behold what lies within the palace
with your own two eyes.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.text:
Open at last. This time, I will
see this through to the end.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.text:
So it's true, Romain?
You've been here before?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.text:
Yes, when I was the same age you are now.
There was something in the palace—something
that waited for me. My father had come with me,
and when he sensed it, he screamed at me to run.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.text:
I obeyed him—I ran. I heard a voice behind me
crying out for me to wait, but I kept running.
I didn't so much as look over my shoulder
until I was back outside the gates.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.speaker: Romain
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_100_CUT_300_.text:
And if anything goes wrong this time,
Alexandre, you must do the same.
Run, my boy—and do not look back.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_DIALOG_000_CUT_.speaker: Marion
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MARION_DIALOG_000_CUT_.text:
Yes, I'm fine. And today, the citizens
of Duvall have a present for you!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_000_CUT.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_000_CUT.text:
Would you like to try my
skiing challenge, Alexandre?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_000_CUT.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_000_CUT.text:
You ski down the hill raising fallen flags.
Oh, and if you get them all in one run,
I'll give you a reward!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_000_CUT.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_000_CUT.text:
Ooo, that sounds like fun!
But won't that be hard?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_000_CUT.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_000_CUT.text:
Well, not for a pro like me, but probably
a little for an amateur like you. Still,
you can keep trying until you get it.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_010_CUT.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_010_CUT.text:
Holy wow! You got them all in one run!
I didn't think anyone around here could
do that but me... Well, as promised, here's your
reward. Hope you enjoy it!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_010_CUT.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_010_CUT.text:
Seeing as you're such a natural, there's
actually another way that I set the course
for my own professional training runs.
Want to give that a try?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_020_CUT.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_020_CUT.text:
I need to train more. I'm...
I'm supposed to be a champion!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_020_CUT.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_DIALOG_020_CUT.text: Uh-oh. I think I upset Morgane.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.text:
Do you have a minute, Alexandre? I've been getting the ski area ready to reopen,
but some of the people on our staff are saying
they saw a ghost, and it's brought everything
to a screeching halt.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.text: Have YOU seen the ghost, Morgane?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.text:
Nope. Apparently this specter only comes out
if you screw up while skiing down the hill and
raising the flags—and since I've never failed
at that, I've never seen the ghost.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.text:
Well, we're more than capable of failing
at that! Don't worry, we'll take a look and
see what this ghost business is about.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.speaker: Morgane
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_MORGANE_KEYQUEST_000_C.text:
I'm hoping you can drive the thing away, but I
suppose just launching an investigation is a
good start. Still, I wonder if this is another
aspect of the final emperor's curse...

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_SKIPOLES_CHECK_000_CUT.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_SKIPOLES_CHECK_000_CUT.text:
Ah, nuts. We blew it.
Want to give it another shot?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_DIALOG_000_CUT_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_DIALOG_000_CUT_00.text:
Have you heard of any ancient artifacts
being found in these mines, Eric?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_DIALOG_000_CUT_00.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_DIALOG_000_CUT_00.text:
Can't say that I have, but feel free
to go inside and poke around.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.text:
Have you heard of any ancient artifacts
being found in these mines, Eric?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Eric
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.text:
Well, this mine has been operational since the
Imperial era, so it wouldn't surprise me none
to learn there's a buncha forgotten treasure
hidin' somewhere in the down deep. Problem is, the older parts of the mine
are all filled with fiends.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ERIC_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.text:
We'll make sure not to go anywhere
too dangerous. Oh, and thanks!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_QUEST_000_CU.speaker: Guillaume
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_GUILLAUME_QUEST_000_CU.text:
I dug this up in my fields some time ago
and decided to keep it, but then I completely
forgot about it! It's yours if you want it.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_DIALOG_000_C.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_DIALOG_000_C.text:
Have you heard of any ancient artifacts
being found in these mines, Esperance?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_DIALOG_000_C.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_DIALOG_000_C.text:
These are working mines, not historical ruins.
But if you want to go looking for stuff like
that, it's no skin off my teeth. I mean,
you saved these mines, after all.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_DIALOG_100_C.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_DIALOG_100_C.text:
Have you heard of any ancient artifacts
being found in these mines, Esperance?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_DIALOG_100_C.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_DIALOG_100_C.text:
These are working mines, not historical
ruins—and before you ask, there's nothing
I can do to help when some of them are
still frozen solid. Now then, I don't mean to be rude,
but I really don't have time for
this kind of thing now—so shoo.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_QUEST_000_CU.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_QUEST_000_CU.text:
Have you heard of any ancient artifacts
being found in these mines, Esperance?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_QUEST_000_CU.speaker: Esperance
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_QUEST_000_CU.text:
These are working mines, not historical ruins.
But if you want to go looking for stuff like
that, it's no skin off my teeth. I mean,
you saved these mines, after all.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_QUEST_000_CU.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ESPERANCE_QUEST_000_CU.text: Think this is one of the artifacts?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.text:
How's it going, Virgile? You suffering
any side effects from being frozen?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.text:
Physically, I seem to be fine.
But that dream... Well, it haunts me.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.text:
That's too bad—though it sounds
like you're not the only one.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.text:
The only other thing that bugs me is the wood.
See, before I was frozen, I cut up a whole bunch
of firewood, but now I can't remember where I
went and left all the bundles. Guess I'll just have to suck it up
and go cut a bunch of new wood.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.text:
I could go look for it if you want.
I mean, it'd sure be handy to have
lots of firewood around, right?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_000_CUT_.text: Sure thing! Leave it to me!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_010_CUT_.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_010_CUT_.text:
Well, I'll be damned!
You found all the wood! Work like that deserves a reward,
so feel free to help yourself
to anything from my cabin.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_010_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_010_CUT_.text:
Actually, Virgile, we found this while
we were out there gathering wood.
Is it yours?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_010_CUT_.speaker: Virgile
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_010_CUT_.text:
Nope. Never seen it before.
But hey, finders keepers, eh?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_010_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_VIRGILE_QUEST_010_CUT_.text:
Well then, I guess I'll
just hang onto it.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_DIALOG_000_CUT_00.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_DIALOG_000_CUT_00.text:
Have you heard of any ancient artifacts
being found in these mines, Remi?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_DIALOG_000_CUT_00.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_DIALOG_000_CUT_00.text:
Sure, I've heard plenty of rumors like that.
If you want to go treasure hunting sometime,
feel free to knock yourself out.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.text:
Have you heard of any ancient artifacts
being found in these mines, Remi?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.text:
Nope. And even if this place was filled
with gold crowns and diamond-tipped canes,
there's no way I'd let you wander around
these dangerous old tunnels!

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.text: If you wanna go, then go. But Alexandre and I are waiting here.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.text: See? Nothing. Just like I said.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.speaker: Remi
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_REMI_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_.text:
However, I DID find a certain something in
there a long time ago. If this is the sort
of thing you're looking for, you can have it.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_DIALOG_000_CU.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_DIALOG_000_CU.text:
You sure seem excited about
something today, Sandrine.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_DIALOG_000_CU.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_DIALOG_000_CU.text:
Ah, Alexandre. It's good that you came.
My people and I have a present for you.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_KEYQUEST_000_.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_KEYQUEST_000_.text:
Good day to you, Alexandre.
What brings you to Varsailles?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_KEYQUEST_000_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_KEYQUEST_000_.text:
We wanted to research ancient
seals at the museum.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_KEYQUEST_000_.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_KEYQUEST_000_.text:
Well, aren't you a studious young man!
I don't care much about antiquities myself;
they come from a crude, backwards era bereft
of the sort of refined beauty that I value.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_KEYQUEST_000_.speaker: Sandrine
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_SANDRINE_KEYQUEST_000_.text:
However, the museum's history corner does have
some authentic ancient inscriptions, as well as
books on deciphering them by the famed alchemist
Nicolas Flamel. Feel free to help yourself.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_KEYQUEST_000_CUT_000_0.text: Think this is one of the artifacts?

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.text:
That's the first bundle of wood.
Gee, it sure looks heavy!

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: None
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.text:
You got the second bundle of firewood.
Just four more to go.

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: None
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.text:
You got the third bundle of firewood.
Just three more to go.

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: None
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.text:
You got the fourth bundle of firewood.
Just two more to go.

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: None
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.text:
You got the fifth bundle of firewood.
Just one more to go.

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_WOODPILE_000_CUT_000_0.text:
This is the last bundle of firewood.
Let's take 'em back to Virgile's cabin.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ICECASTLE_021_CUT_010_.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ICECASTLE_021_CUT_010_.text:
Ah, Alexandre. I got a taste of the final
emperor's power and lost all control of myself.
I pray you grow into a better man than me.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ICECASTLE_021_CUT_010_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ICECASTLE_021_CUT_010_.text:
It wasn't your fault, Gabriel.
It was all because of the emperor.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ICECASTLE_021_CUT_010_.speaker: Gabriel
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_ICECASTLE_021_CUT_010_.text:
The final emperor is a pitiful
creature...just as I'd suspected...

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_FUNICULAR_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_FUNICULAR_000_CUT_000_.text: So where do we want to go?

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_FUNICULAR_000_CUT_000_.speaker: HERO
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_FUNICULAR_000_CUT_000_.text: Let's try the ski slope entrance.

SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_FUNICULAR_000_CUT_000_.speaker: HERO
SUB_W12_GIMK_COMM_FUNICULAR_000_CUT_000_.text: Let's head down to the ravine.

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_EXIT_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_EXIT_000_CUT_000_000.text:
This looks like a portal to another world.
Are you gonna go through it?

SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_010_CUT_200_.speaker: Alexandre
SUB_W12_EVAR_COMM_FENCEGATE_010_CUT_200_.text: Guess luck isn't on our side today.
